Uses of Class
Manix

    • Uses of Manix in <Unnamed>

      Methods in <Unnamed> that return Manix 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <N extends java.lang.Number>
      Manix      		 Manix.add(Manix addend, java.lang.Class<N> numberType)
      Adds each element of the addend to the respective element of this matrix.
      Creates a new matrix and leaves this matrix unaltered.
      <N extends java.lang.Number>
      Manix      		 Manix.dot(Manix multiplicand, java.lang.Class<N> numberType)
      Performs matrix multiplication with this matrix on the left side of the product.
      Creates a new matrix and leaves this matrix unaltered.
      static Manix Manix.fill(java.lang.Number value, int rows, int columns)
      Provides a new matrix with each element specified by value.
      Static for quality of life.
      static Manix Manix.I(int size)
      Provides a new identity matrix.
      Static for quality of life.
      Manix[] Manix.LU()
      Performs LU factorization on this matrix.
      <N extends java.lang.Number>
      Manix      		 Manix.mul(Manix multiplicand, java.lang.Class<N> numberType)
      Hadamard multiplication: multiplies each element of the multiplicand with the respective element of this matrix.
      Creates a new matrix and leaves this matrix unaltered.
      <N extends java.lang.Number>
      Manix      		 Manix.mul(java.lang.Number b, java.lang.Class<N> numberType)
      Multiplies this matrix by b.
      Creates a new matrix and leaves this one unaltered
      static Manix Manix.Null(int rows, int columns)
      Provides a new matrix with 0's everywhere.
      Calls the fill() method.
      Static for quality of life.
      static Manix Manix.rand(int rows, int columns)
      Creates a new matrix with random values everywhere.
      Static for quality of life.
      Values can be scaled with mul(Number, Class) and shifted with add(Number, Class) or sub(Number, Class).
      Manix Manix.reshape(int rows, int cols)
      Reshapes this m by n matrix into a rows by cols matrix.
      Each element is placed into the new matrix sequentially.
      <N extends java.lang.Number>
      Manix      		 Manix.sub(Manix minuend, java.lang.Class<N> numberType)
      Subtracts each element of the minuend from the respective element of this matrix.
      Creates a new matrix and leaves this matrix unaltered.
      Manix Manix.T()
      Creates a new, transposed version of this matrix and leaves this matrix unaltered.
